citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for rabies at 16 weeks, then at 1 year, and then every 3 years going forward.
14 adult dogs did not have a record of a current rabies vaccine

Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo, and rabies
which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination schedule approved by the
attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or contagious diseases.
Correct by 25 February 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently 
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for rabies at 16 weeks, then at 1 year, and then every 3 years going forward.  
 
14 adult dogs did not have a record of a current rabies vaccine

#900219001693955 DOB 5/1/2024 
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the 
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo, and rabies 
which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination schedule approved by the 
attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or contagious diseases.  
 
Correct by 25 February 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
